stories.text:
I plug my phone into my 2017 Subaru Outback to play music and charge the battery, but why can't it also act like a giant antennae and increase the cellular signal?

Are external antennae not a thing for cell phones?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why don't cars amplify cell signals?

stories.text:
Increasing tracking of smaller fonts makes them much more readable. The modern web design uses a lot of white space, so there's rarely a penalty for doing this.

Go to a website, open developer tools, select a text which is smaller than body copy and add this style:

    letter-spacing: 0.05em
(Or reduce to 0.02em if the font is on the larger side).

It makes a lot of difference! Especially applied to text set in all caps.

I've seen tracking used extensively on Apple websites, which I guess is not surprising given their design roots.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why letter-spacing of small fonts is still rare on the web?
BTF (BPF Type Format): A Practical Guide
Portl 2.0 explained by inventor, David Nussbaum
